sub_title: Police Officer la General Inspectorate of Romanian Police - Brigade for Countering Organized Crime
summary:
I have more than 10 years of experience in very different and complex areas of expertise, like countering criminal groups specialized in smuggling, tax evasion, money laundering or criminal offences regarding fraud affecting the Union's financial interests.
This experience was accumulated during my activity in dozens of investigations carried out within: 
-The Fight Against Fraud Department, where, for more than 4 years, my entire activity was focused on combating fraud affecting European Union's financial interest, ensuring that legal persons can be held liable for any of the criminal offences, providing a report containing the evidence for serious financial offences which affected EU’s financial interests.
-Control Body of The Prime Minister, where, in more than 3 years, my reports were an important part of investigations undertaken personally, or by coordinating my teams as a Director, in cases involving projects financed with governmental funds and offences affecting the national budget's financial interests.
-Romanian National Police - Brigade for Countering Organized Crime, where I worked, as lead investigator or part of investigative teams, in Countering Terrorism Financing and Money Laundering Department and the main responsibility consisted in discovering, countering and undertaking criminal investigation regarding crimes committed in the financial domains by organized crime groups (fraud, money laundering and smuggling).
Most of my knowledge I achieved in a self-learning manner from the necessity to solve complex cases in short periods of time.
I consider that the experience acquired, the knowledge achieved in the crime investigation, legal, economic and financial domain, and, also, the ability to adapt anytime to new situations can help me to overcome any situation and circumstances that could intervene in my activity.
I have a solid knowledge in law enforcement investigative techniques, most important in money laundering techniques and methods, also in financial investigation techniques and methods as well as knowledge and experience of the techniques relating to the identification, freezing, management and confiscation of assets.
Many times, I proved that I can work in stressful conditions, and I participated in many cases of criminal investigation and countering organized crime.
Also, I have excellent written and verbal communication skills, I get along extremely well with my colleagues and I earned everyone’s trust due to my commitment to work.

I acquired experience in financial investigation methods and techniques relating to the identification, freezing, management and confiscation of assets.', 'title': 'Police Officer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'The Fight Against Fraud Department (Ro: DLAF)', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bucharest, Romania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'The Fight Against Fraud Department (Ro: DLAF)', 'description': "As a police officer I was detached, temporary, from Romanian National Police to the The Fight Against Fraud Department – DLAF (the contact institution of the European Anti-Fraud Office - OLAF within the European Commission), to carry out special activities, like:
-  analysing information and documents relevant transmitted by public institutions and individuals in order to establish if there are grounds to initiate an investigation.
- establishing the competence of DLAF`s authority according to the national and European Union criminal and civil law ensuring that fraud, when committed intentionally, constitutes a criminal offence. 
- performing on-the-spot controls and financial investigations relating projects financed with European funds, to identify possible irregularities, frauds or criminal offences with regard to fraud affecting the Union's financial interests. 
- gather information, extracting and analysing information from national databases.
- exchange information using the national and European cooperation channels of communications with European AntiFraud Office - OLAF within the European Commission and EU Member States Anti-fraud coordination services (AFCOS) in relation to fraud investigations. 
- carrying joint investigations with OLAF’s representatives and providing, by request, operational support or technical assistance to the representatives of OLAF. 
- performing operative on-the-spot controls following the allegations received from OLAF, from national authorities having competencies in managing the Community financial assistance or ex officio allegations; 
- handle fraud investigations files by elaborating special documents, taking statements of parts involved, writing reports, investigation work plans.
- in case of criminal offences, I notify the National Anticorruption Directorate for holding the persons criminally responsible for their acts, as well as for taking the legal measures to make the funds unavailable and to recover the prejudice.", 'title': 'Fraud Investigator', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Control Body of The Prime Minister – Romanian Government', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Bucharest, Romania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Control Body of The Prime Minister – Romanian Government', 'description': "As a police officer I was detached, temporary, from Romanian National Police to the Romanian Government-Control Body of The Prime Minister as a Director, to manage and coordinate multiple teams and to conduct investigative works in administrative, financial and economic crimes.
The main activity consisted in controlling the activity of Ministries and their decentralized public services, public institutions, national companies, trading companies and financial-banking institutions with state majority capital under Government's authority, and elaborate reports and investigation notes for the information of the Romanian Prime Minister.
To fulfil these activities, I had the following attributes: 
-Providing advice concerning national and international criminal or civil law and releasing written or verbal measures compulsory for all the subordinated staff. 
-Checking complaints and reports from Romanian public institutions, legal entities, private individuals and European institutions. 
-Analysing information and documents transmitted by public institutions and individuals to establish if there are grounds to initiate an investigation. 
-Approving department paper works: control orders, control reports, investigation notes, synthesis, information notes, legal points of view and official addresses. 
-Involving in financial investigations relating projects financed with governmental funds and offences regarding fraud affecting the national budget's financial interests. 
-Verification of the way of duties performed by the department personnel, the quality of control results such as reports, notes and other documents created by the subordinated staff. 
The reports and investigation notes that I undertook represented official documents for the information of the Prime minister and, also, for the information of the prosecutors regarding possible law-breaking acts found as result of action controls.", 'title': 'Director', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}, {'location': 'Bucharest, Romania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2013}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Control Body of The Prime Minister – Romanian Government', 'description': "I was detached from Romanian Police to the Romanian Government for a period of almost 3 years, where, under Romanian Prime Minister`s authority I performed financial investigations relating projects financed with governmental funds and offences about fraud affecting the national budget's financial interests.
As a police officer I was detached, temporary, to carry out special activities, like: 
- performing action controls, administrative, financial and economic investigations and to draft the investigation notes regarding the activity of Ministries and their decentralized public services, public institutions, national companies, trading companies and financial-banking institutions with state majority capital under Government's authority.
-settling the petitions and other requests of public interest, to analyse and approve, for legal point of view, the control reports, notes, synthesis and other documents.
-preparing and presenting, within a short deadline, at the request of Control Body of the Prime Minister management board, the legal point of view regarding the competence of the institution, the legality of different motions, initiatives and other legal measures. 
In order to fulfil my duties, I performed the following: 
-Establishing and studying the applicable legislation for each entity that I controlled and the competence of the institution regarding the reported offence. 
-Verification regarding main activities, legal framework. 
-Investigation of the process of public money investment, public procurement, budget planning and any others legal domain regarding the public affairs.
In general, my work consisted of drafting investigation notes, in a very short deadline, representing official documents for the information of the Prime minister and for the information of the prosecutors regarding possible law-breaking acts found as result of action controls in the administrative, financial and economic affairs.", 'title': 'Principal Investigator', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}]
